meanings.definition: Toadying: the act of behaving in a subservient or sycophantic manner towards someone in a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: Her constant toadying to the boss made her unpopular with her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The toadying of the new intern towards the CEO was obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The toadying of the dog to its owner for treats was both amusing and endearing.
meanings.sent4: The toadying of the politician to the wealthy donors was shamelessly transparent.
meanings.sent5: The toadying of the character in the play to the villain was a memorable moment of betrayal.

meanings.definition: Toadying: characterized by excessive flattery or ingratiating behavior.
meanings.sent1: His toadying behavior towards his superiors was off-putting to his coworkers.
meanings.sent2: The toadying waiter constantly complimented the customers to earn bigger tips.
meanings.sent3: The toadying salesman's over-the-top compliments made the customers chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The toadying smile on her face didn't quite reach her eyes, revealing her insincerity.
meanings.sent5: The toadying tone of his voice grated on her nerves, making her distrust his intentions.
